outputs.output_descr:
BRC ICRIN: Human Security in Chernobyl (regional). 
Human Security for Individuals and Communities in Chernobyl-Affected Areas through Local Information Provision (International Chernobyl Research and Information Network)
outputs.output_title: BRC ICRIN: Human Security in C

outputs.output_descr: Regional ICRIN: Support for UN Chernobyl Coordination. In line with a shift in strategy from humanitarian assistance to development aid, UNDP assumed responsibility for UN-wide coordination of Chernobyl issues in 2004. This project aims to promote the recovery of communities affected by Chernobyl by 1) supporting the work of the Chernobyl Coordinator in efforts to mobilize resources, promote synergies in UNDP field work on Chernobyl, and build productive relationships with the Governments of the three most-affected countries; and 2) gaining visibility for UNDP's role and key messages through participation in events marking the anniversaries of the Chernobyl accident; 3) leading the Chernobyl-related advocacy and community recovery initiatives with involvement of UNDP Goodwill Ambassador Maria Sharapova and organizing her field visit to the Chenorbyl-affected areas of Belarus.

project_descr: Human Security for Individuals and Communities in Chernobyl-Affected areas through local informational provision (ICRIN).
project_title: Human Security for Individuals&Communities in Chernobyl
